#Potential R-Packages to Use:

*   [DerekYves/placement](https://www.r-bloggers.com/placement-an-r-package-to-access-the-google-maps-api/)
    +   [DerekYves/placement github](https://github.com/DerekYves/placement)
    +   This package seems to be able to nicely format the response from the google API.
    
*   [RgoogleMaps](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/RgoogleMaps/RgoogleMaps.pdf)
    +   used to extract map and visualize.

*   [ggmap](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/ggmap/ggmap.pdf)



# Google Maps APIs Course:
*   [google Maps API Course](https://www.udacity.com/course/google-maps-apis--ud864)

# Exploring Tools:
*   [google api console](https://console.developers.google.com/iam-admin/projects?pli=1)

## Notes:
*   You can render your own maps (for websites)
    +   default
    +   real life 
    +   hybrid (default + real life)
    +   Terrian (terrian information)
